On 01/12/05, didoss@... <didoss@...> wrote:
> Preaching to =
the choir,...yep, it's a large problem,...yep, it needs attention,...nope, =
it's not getting the attention.  We have ~6500 tests (questionable level of=
 "unit" versus "higher-than-unit") that take ~3.5 hours to run (additional =
time for building, reporting, etc. brings the nightly build up to 4+ hours)=
.

This may not be the big problem you think it is.

A four+ hour nightly b=
uild isn't really a problem - there is no-one in
the office. The problem is=
 that you lack fast feedback during the day.

If you can come up with a day=
-time build that takes less time (e.g. by
seperating tests into fast vs slo=
w), you can then focus on getting the
coverage of this build to a point whe=
re you are confident that if it
passes, the nightly build will pass.

(Conf=
ident !=3D certain, naturally)

In this way, you can still get quick builds=
, but have the safety net
of the longer build overnight.
